msDesc.head: Sermons (Peregrinus de Oppeln (?), Jacobus de Voragine, etc.); A-C Germany, 15th century, first quarter

physDesc.p: Three codicological units together by the late fifteenth century at the latest.

supportDesc.extent: 1 + 137 (108 + 16 + 12+1: fol. 126 is double, with fol. 126(b) being a slip inserted between fols. 126(a) and 127) + 1 290 210
supportDesc.collation: singleton, 1(12)-3(12) (fols. 2–27), 4(10) (fols. 38–47), 5(14) (fols. 48–61), 6(12)-9(12) (fols. 62–109) | 11(16) (fols. 110–125) | 12(12) (fols. 126(a)-137), singleton. Quires 1–7 numbered in arabic on the bottom centre of the opening recto.

binding.p: Fifteenth-century binding of plain leather on boards; clasps lost; bosses on upper and lower boards lost; contemporary labels with contents and pressmark on upper board.

history.provenance: Erfurt, Charterhouse: 15th-century ex libris, fols. 1r, 138r; 17th(?)-century ex libris, fol. 2r; pressmark O.9 on the cover; identifiable as O.92 (not O.9, as in the Summary Catalogue, and repeated by Krämer, Handschriftenerbe) in the late-fifteenth-century catalogue (ed. P. Lehmann, p. 503).
Not certainly identifiable in the 1836 catalogue of the Friedrich Gottlieb Julius von Bülow sale: perhaps no. 168 ('Sermones de sanctis')
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford (Nov. 2020). Previously described in the Summary Catalogue (1897). Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 24 Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 25

listBibl.head: Online resources:

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.bibl: Balázs József Nemes, Bibliotheca Cartusiae Erfordiensis : Dokumentation über den überlieferten Buchbestand der Erfurter Kartause, 3., korrigierte und erweiterte Version (2022) DOI: 10.6094/UNIFR/223370

ref.title: Handschriftencensus: Eine Bestandsaufnahme der handschriftlichen Überlieferung deutschsprachiger Texte des Mittelalters

msItem.note: For fol. 1 see endleaves, below.

msItem.title: Sermones de sanctis (Hieron. de Salzburg collecti aut variati)
(Collectio sermonum ‘Flores de sanctis’ siue ‘Piper’)

msItem.incipit: Simili pena seruus ... Filius Dei considerans

msItem.explicit: sic saluus erit. Quod nobis prestare dignetur pater et filius et spiritus sanctus Amen etc. etc. etc.

msItem.title: Prayer

note.q: Nve helfft mir bethe vor daz wandel der heylygen cristenheyt Sonder vor eynen stete frede dez landes vor vnsern geystlich vater den babest vor alle syne kardenal vor alle bysschoff vor alle presterliche werdykeyt dar nach helfft mir flyszlich bethe vor den romischen konigk

msItem.note: Added in a different hand.

msItem.title: Abstractum-Glossar A-I
msItem.note: Added by another hand in two columns on an originally blank leaf.
Fol. 109r-v blank.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermarks, bull's head with five-petalled flower, resembling Piccard xii.151–2 (1416–18); bell (without shoulder, mouth consisting in one line, without yoke, with clapper); bull's head with Latin cross, resembling Piccard xi.106

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 42–45 lines; frame-ruled, ruled space 215–20 140 , 12mm between columns.

handDesc.handNote: Cursive; probably two hands, (a) fols. 2ra-va, 3ra-5vb; (b) fols. 2va-b, 4vb-108rb; later additions in cursive by two other hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Coloured red initials of 4 lines (fol. 2) or 2 lines, sometimes with simple decoration.

msItem.incipit: Oculi domini super iustos Tribus modis orationes nostre inpediuntur quod a deo non exaudiuntur. Primo qui orat ut de inimicis suis ulcisatur
msItem.note: Abbreviated from Honorius of Autun, Speculum ecclesiae, PL 172.949B-953B

msItem.incipit: De rogacionibus que dicitur letania minor. Maior vero peragitur in die marci, instituto a gregoria magno in urbe romano pro magno et grauissimo morbo
msItem.explicit: angelum domini qui gladium cruentatum detergentem et in vaginam mittentem et intellexit quod pestis ista cessasset et statutum est ut castrum istud castrum angeli vocaretur
msItem.note: From Jacobus de Voragine, Legenda Aurea, cc. 70 (de letania) and 46 (de sancto Gregorio, sect. 4): ed. Graesse, pp. 312–3, 190–2
Rest of fol. 110vb blank.

msItem.incipit: Mittite partes eiuseis qui non preparaverunt sibi Consuetudo est quando aliqui usque ad mortem infirmati uel ad mortem flagellati aut in carcere ad mortem cruciati ad amicos suos karissimos
msItem.note: Text continued in the lower margin of the page; the end lost through trimming. Cf. Schneyer V.432 (49) (Sifridus OP), VIII.705 (50), IX.535 (59).

msItem.incipit: Egressus Ihesus perambulabat Iherico etc. Hystoria patet et ideo eam obmittamus et sensum moralem que multum edificat
msItem.explicit: Hodie salus huic domui facta est id est anime nostre et corpori nostro vt nos manere mereamur cum in domo sua in eternum, quod nobis prestare dignetur
msItem.note: Begins as BSB, Clm 28454 fol. 1ra and Augsburg UB Cod. II.1.fol.46 fol. 303va, but the ending differs.

msItem.incipit: Epyphania domini quadruplici decoratur miraculo, et ideo quadruplici vocabulo nuncupatur
msItem.author: Jacobus de Voragine
msItem.title: Legenda Aurea: c. xiv

msItem.incipit: Hodie magnificata est anima mea De multiplicibus gaudiis marie legimus in scripturis. Et singulariter de vij
msItem.explicit: marie precibus saluatur hic et in futurum Amen

msItem.incipit: Omnes sunt administratorii Duo notantur hic scilicet admirabilis clemencia diuine pietatis dando homini angelum ad custodia secundo condignitas humane nature
msItem.explicit: Hoc est distribucio ministeriorum descendencium quo ad diuinam misericordiam circa nos

msItem.incipit: Quis ex vobis vestrum habebit amicum et ibit ad eum Modo sunt dies rogacionum fratres karissimi et oracionum et ideo dignum
msItem.explicit: venenum in cauda gerit. Itaque qui a deo onum et spem celestium querit non scorpionum retro ad terrena recipit, ergo fratres karissimi nolite petere a deo que petenda non sunt sed celestia assidue et terrena in necessitate
msItem.note: Geoffrey Babio 29 (Schneyer II.152–3, PL 171.574–577A)

msItem.incipit: O vos omnes qui transitis Verba preposita scripta sunt per prophetam Jeremiam et sunt verba ipsius Christi que poterat dicere cum pro nobis in cruce penderet manibus et pedibus transfossus et omnia membra dolerent, tunc flendo dicere poterat O uos omnes
(fol. 118vb) Multa sunt que nos ad fletum ducunt que transfero propter prolixitatem sermonis. Super omnia debet vnum nos mouere, quod hodie fratres fratrem interfecerunt
msItem.explicit: Quicumque contristatus fuerit hodie cum hac mestissima matre, illo gaudio celesti eum cum felice matre maria in eternum debet perfrui, ad quod nos christus per suam passionem peruenire concedat, qui cum patre
msItem.colophon: Explicit passio domini nostri iesu christi scripta per manus Heinrici Rulandi.
msItem.note: Begins as Johannes Contractus (not in Schneyer; printed in the edition of not after 1478, istc ic00871000), but varies soon after the beginning.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermark, bull's head with six(?)-petalled flower, indistinct, not closely resembling any examples in Piccard or Briquet

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 45–47 lines; frame-ruled, ruled space 240–5 150 , 13mm. between columns.

handDesc.handNote: Cursive; one hand, Heinricus Rulandi (colophon, fol. 125vb)

decoDesc.decoNote: 2-line coloured red initials with simple decoration.

msItem.title: Sermones de tempore: dom. 2–10 post oct. Pent.
msItem.incipit: Homo quidem fecit cenam magnam Cum homo ad ymaginem dei sit factus, non est incongruum
msItem.note: Schneyer III.221–235 nos. 89 (text partially repeated on fol. 126(b), an inserted slip, from 'circa ista cena tria notantur, scilicet inuitantis magna liberalitas' to 'secundum puritatem manuum mearum retribuet mihi'), 90, 93–5, 98 (beginning at 'In isto ewangelio instruuntur auditores verbi' and ending at 'Ps. Ignitum tuum eloquium vehementer'), 99–100, 101 (beg. some way through at 'Nota quod iusticia phariseorum erat nimis seuera, Mt. v Audistis'), 105 (signficantly longer than as pr. [not after 1478], istc ij00193000, ending 'reuerencia cum signo corporis'), 110 ('dominica 8', again significantly longer than pr., ending 'ut pauperes eos in sua hereditate collocet et utrumque per alium collocentur'), , 102, 103 (ending at 'de quo dicitur Mt. xxxij Omnis qui ...'), 113 ('dominica ixa', beginning 'dicit ewangelium quod cum dominus appropinquaret ad descensum montis oliuati turbe sibi occurrerunt cum canticis' and ending at 'uel saltem leuiter subridentem'), 114 (followed by a note that the third sermon 'Domus mea domus' is found in the quadragesimale), 116 ('dominica xa'), 117 (ending varies, here squeezed into the lower margin).

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermark, bull's head with six(?)-petalled flower, indistinct, not closely resembling any examples in Piccard or Briquet

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 51–52 lines. Frame-ruled, ruled space 250 165 , 10mm. between columns.

decoDesc.decoNote: 2-line coloured red initials with simple decoration.

msItem.author: Giles of Rome
msItem.title: Commentary on (Ps.-)Aristotle, De Bona Fortuna
msItem.incipit: Quidam ordinant in idem bonam fortunam felicitati ut uult philosophus
msItem.note: Ed. 1551 (USTC 859499) fols. 72va-74ra

msItem.author: Peter of Auvergne
msItem.title: Commentary on Aristotle's De senectute et iuuentute
msItem.explicit: quod suffocatorio apposito continue cito corrumpitur cum
msItem.note: Ed. 1551 (as above), fols. 58rb-60ra

supportDesc.extent: Two separate folios from the same manuscript 285 200

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 52 lines. Ruled space 265 165 with 15 mm. between columns.

msItem.title: Logic
msItem.note: The text in one column, upper pastedown, one section begins:
msItem.incipit: Sed terminus exponibilis est omnis terminus ratione cuius propositio habet duas exponentes uel plures cum quibus conuertitur ut sunt signa vniversalia affirmatiua omnis comparatiuus et superlatiuus
msItem.note: The text in one column, lower pastedown, one section begins:
msItem.incipit: Terminorum alius mediatus alius inmediatus. Inmediatus est omnis ratione cuius proposito non potest probari ut sunt termini singulares et verba substantiua uel terminus communis cum pronomine demonstratiuo supponens ut sor, iste homo, sum

msItem.title: Grammar
msItem.note: The text in two columns, upper pastedown, one section begins:
Quotes Alexander de Villa Dei, Doctrinale.
The text in two columns, lower pastedown:
msItem.incipit: Absolon q. pater pacis. Pauper q. pauca petens. Sanctus q. confirmatus
msItem.note: Partly a list of words and names with their meanings and figural uses, partly notes on grammar.

supportDesc.extent: Parts of two bifolia from the same manuscript 200 145

layoutDesc.layout: Partly in one column, 29–30 lines, frame-ruled, ruled space 140 90
Partly in two columns, 37–8 lines, frame-ruled, ruled space 165 120

revisionDesc.change: New draft description for Polonsky German.
